clusterList.phrase: for if the bookseller is criminally liable without knowledge of the contents he will tend to restrict the books he sells to those he has inspected and thus the state will have imposed a restriction upon the distribution of constitutionally protected as well as obscene literature and the bookseller's burden would become the public's burden for by restricting him the public's access to reading matter would be restricted h is timidity in the face of his absolute criminal liability thus would tend to restrict the public's access to forms of the printed word which the state could not constitutionally 376 u s 254 279 suppress directly the bookseller's self-censorship compelled by the state would be a censorship affecting the whole public hardly less virulent for being privately administered through it the distribution of all books both obscene and not obscene would be impeded
